results.title: The Big hit [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Warren Zide, Wesley Snipes and Che-Kirk Wong
results.brief_description: Mark Wahlberg stars as an anxiety ridden killer for hire who is part of an elite team of hitmen (made up of Lou Diamond Philips, Antonio Sabato Jr. and Bokeem Woodbine) in this violent action comedy. Wahlberg’s chaotic domestic life and stressful blood soaked professional life come unstuck when the kidnapping of a wealthy businessman’s daughter has major repercussions for the band of killers. From its fetishistic reconstruction of the code and conduct of organized crime, right down to its casual, flippant depictions of violence, “The Big hit” owes a lot to the films of Quentin Tarantino (which are in themselves pastiches of various European and American filmmakers). However the spectre of the Hong Kong action film hangs over them all (“The Big hit” goes as far as enlisting Hong Kong action director Che-Kirk Wong and the executive producer is the legendary John Woo), a cinema that is wonderfully inventive with its own form of genre splicing and indirect homage. Cast also includes Christina Applegate, Elliot Gould, Laine Kazan and Avery Brooks.

results.title: The Big easy
results.creator_credit: Kings Road Entertainment, Stephen J. Friedman and Jim McBride
results.brief_description: The Big Easy is a sexy thriller romance set in New Orleans. When a member of the mafia is murdered in downtown New Orleans, Remy McSwain (Dennis Quaid) and Anne Osborne (Ellen Barkin) are unwittingly forced together as they pursue the murderer who may or may not be a cop. Barkin’s starchy D.A. prosecutor disapproves of the shady ethical practises of McSwain and his ‘Big Easy’ co-workers, who view bribery as a normal way of life. Remy McSwain, who comes from a large family of New Orleans policemen starts to reevaluate his values and life as he and Osborne become closer. Jim McBride has created a rivetting and fun film which revels in it’s complex characters and in the sizzling chemistry between Dennis Quaid and Ellen Barkin. Ned Beatty and Charles Ludlam are good in supporting roles and the film pulses with great cajun music and a sense of life in New Orleans.

results.title: The Big combo
results.creator_credit: Allied Artists Pictures, Sidney Harmon and Joseph Lewis
results.brief_description: This is not just another gangster movie, but far more a private obsessional duel, a battle of wills between a smooth-tongued gangster and a fixated cop, which is resolved in terms of individual foibles and motivations. The film deals with a new brand of corporate business-minded gangster. The film’s two main characters (Leonard Diamond and Mr. Brown) run along parallel lines: both are haunted by chimeras of innocence, they are both aggressive in the pursuit of their differing ambitions. Stars Cornel Wilde, Richard Conte, Brian Donlevy, Jean Wallace.

results.title: The Big chill [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Michael Shamberg and Lawrence Kasdan
results.brief_description: The archetypal “Baby Boomers” movie of the 80’s which focuses on a group of college friends from the 60’s who have exchanged their radical ideals for Mercedes’ and “Yuppiedom”. In coming together at the funeral of one of their group, they strive to regain touch, not only with one another but with themselves. What follows is a weekend of drugs, sex, a re-examination of their anti-establishment days and a reconciliation of their past with their present. “In a cool world you need your friends to keep you warm.” This film will remain a nostalgic favourite. It features a great soundtrack and an early screen appearance by Kevin Costner as the corpse. Cast includes Tom Berenger, Glenn Close, Jeff Goldblum, William Hurt, Kevin Kline, Mary Kay Place, Meg Tilly and Jobeth Williams.

results.title: The Bicycle thieves = Ladri di biciclette
results.brief_description: An unemployed man is offered work as a bill-sticker provided he has his own bicycle. After retrieving his bicycle from the pawnbroker, it is stolen on the very first day of the job and he spends a day with his small son, desperately trying to find it. Hollywood offered to finance De Sica’s film, but he refused as he wanted to use non-actors in real settings. ‘The Bicycle thieves’ is an important film which explores the dignity of the ordinary person. It’s simplicity and underlying social criticism are part of its wide appeal.

results.title: The BFG
results.creator_credit: Cosgrove-Hall Productions, Mark Hall and Brian Cosgrove
results.brief_description: Adapted from Roald Dahl’s best-selling children’s book, this animated feature tells the story of Sophie, a little orphan girl and her friend, the Big Friendly Giant (the BFG). Sophie and the BFG set out to rid the world of the gruesome “crunching giants” who gobble up children for breakfast. Sophie decides the only person powerful enough to help them is the Queen of England - but will she help?

results.title: The Best years of our lives
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn Productions, Samuel Goldwyn and William Wyler
results.brief_description: Selected by the Library of Congress as one of the most important films of all time, this multi-Oscar winning classic recounts the problems faced by three veterans returning home after World War II, as they attempt to pick up the threads of their civilian lives. Fine performances by Fredric March, Dana Andrews and real-life amputee Harold Russell, and sensitive direction from William Wyler help to make “The Best years of our lives” an unforgettable film experience.

results.title: The Best little whorehouse in Texas [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, RKO Radio Pictures, Thomas Miller, Edward Milkis, Robert L Boyett and Colin Higgins
results.brief_description: A sheriff and a proprietess join together not only in romance, but to fight a big city TV crusader in his efforts to expose the Chicken Ranch to public scandal, and thus close it down. Based on the stage play written by Larry L. King and Peter Masterton. Cast includes Burt Reynolds, Dolly Parton, Dom DeLuise, Charles Durning, Jim Nabors, Robert Mandan.

results.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Rainbow Educational Video and Leo McCarey
results.brief_description: A battle of wits emerges between Father O’Malley and Sister Benedict when their ideas clash in how the children should be taught at St. Mary’s School. However, Sister Benedict takes a tip from his unusual methods and buys a boxing book and a baseball bat, then finds herself in the business of making men out of boys. It’s not Father O’Malley’s only battle. The school is badly in need of repairs and a cynical millionaire has started proceedings to condemn the school building. Starring Ingrid Bergman and Bing Crosby.

results.title: The Belle of New York
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and Charles Walters
results.brief_description: A musical set in New York in the 1890s in which a playboy seeks redemption in the arms of a mission girl. This is the pretext for transforming Astaire’s past decadence into present zaniness and Vera-Ellen’s primness into sauciness. Despite the suggestion of fairytale fantasy - lovers truly in love can literally walk on air - this is at core a folk musical with an idealised New York as a slightly larger version of hometown, a community to be celebrated. Several lively dance numbers are designed to evoke the paintings of Currier and Ives. This was Astaire’s personal favourite of his musicals. Cast also includes Marjorie Main, Keenan Wynn, Alice Pearce, Clinton Sundberg, Gale Robbins. Music by Harry Warren, lyrics by Johnny Mercer.
